section: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service. This purpose may be changed at any time at the discretion of BorrowMoney.com, inc.
explanation: The first sentence defines the purpose of the joint venture. The second sentence allows BorrowMoney.com, inc. to change the purpose at any time at its discretion. This contradicts the initial agreement that both members entered into the venture with a specific purpose in mind. It gives one member unilateral power to alter the fundamental basis of the agreement.

section: Duties of Members may be amended, from time to time, by decision of the Members, provided that the Members' interests are not affected except with the unanimous consent of the Members.
explanation: This section states that the duties of members may be amended with a decision of the members, provided that the members' interests are not affected except with unanimous consent. This is contradictory. If a member's interests are not affected, then a simple decision is enough. If the member's interests are affected then a unanimous consent of the members is required. There is no need to specify that a decision of the members is required if the member's interests are not affected, as that would be the default approach.

section: Any vote required by the Members will be determined such that each Member receives one vote, however, BorrowMoney.com, inc.'s vote will carry twice the weight of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's vote.
explanation: The first part of the sentence states that each member receives one vote. The second part of the sentence contradicts this by stating that BorrowMoney.com, inc.'s vote carries twice the weight of the other member's vote. This makes the voting system unequal and gives more power to BorrowMoney.com, inc.

section: This Agreement may be amended with the consent of BorrowMoney.com, inc., notwithstanding any objection from JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go.
explanation: This section allows BorrowMoney.com, Inc. to unilaterally amend the agreement, regardless of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's objections. This contradicts the fundamental principle of a joint venture, which typically requires mutual agreement and consent for significant changes. It effectively gives BorrowMoney.com, Inc. the power to dictate the terms of the agreement, making it more akin to a controlling interest arrangement than a true joint venture.

section: Where allowed by statute, title to all Venture property, including intellectual property, will remain in the name of the Venture. Where joint ventures are not recognized by statute as separate legal entities, Venture property, including intellectual property, will be held in the name of one or more Members. In all cases Venture property will be applied by the Members exclusively for the benefit and purposes of the Venture and in accordance with this Agreement.
explanation: The first sentence suggests that the Venture can hold title to property if allowed by statute, implying it can be a separate legal entity. The second sentence states that if joint ventures are not recognized as separate legal entities, the property will be held in the name of one or more members. This presents a structural flaw because it doesn't clearly define how property ownership is handled depending on the legal recognition of joint ventures, potentially leading to confusion and disputes regarding ownership and liability.
